page.title: 11Farming - shooting game
page.content: {Game shooting}is widespread in the area but only those with connection to farming participate. This traditional activity{begins on the 1st September, when partridges can be shot. English partridges in this area are rare (French partridges are more common); this is due to the frequent rain during their breeding months.{Pheasant {shooting begins on the 1st October. These birds are reared throughout the year for the game shooting period by the local game-keeper. Without his intervention this annual event may be forced to cease as young birds cannot survive naturally. Both seasons {conclude on the 31st January. Wood pigeons, rabbits and hares are not shot for sport. They are classed as vermin. Game shooting has opposition from anti-bloodsport campaigners.
